speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about this swelling in your right knee? How long have you been experiencing it, and is it constant or does it come and go?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's been a few days now, and it feels like it's getting worse. Sometimes it's really sore, and I have to lie down or put weight on it to make it feel a little better, but other times it's okay, and I can run around like normal."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the pain level associated with the swelling? Is it a dull ache, sharp pain, or more of a throbbing sensation?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's more of a sharp pain, like when I twist my knee or put too much pressure on it. It's really painful when I bend it or move it in certain ways, but it's not always there, just when I do something that aggravates it."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the onset of the swelling? Was it sudden or did it develop gradually over time?

speaker: Patient
text: "Well, I remember playing in the park a few days ago, and after running around, I started feeling a bit weird in my knee. At first, it was just a little sore, but it got worse throughout the day, and by the evening, it was really swollen. It's like something just... shifted or something, and now it's been like that ever since."

speaker: Doctor
text:
So the swelling started about six weeks ago and has been getting progressively worse. The pain is more of a dull ache, but it can get sharp when I move my knee or put weight on it. 

Now, I'd like to take a closer look at the swelling. May I examine your knee for any signs of inflammation or tenderness?

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, go ahead and take a look. I'm a little worried, to be honest. My parents said I should see a doctor about this, and I don't want it to get any worse."

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to take a look at your knee now. Can you please lift your right leg up for me, and I'll examine it further? Also, have you experienced any similar swelling or issues in other parts of your body, such as your elbows or ankles?

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I'll lift my leg up. Um, no, I don't think so... I mean, I haven't noticed anything else like it. My parents said that my uncle had similar problems, but that's about it, I guess. I'm not really sure what to think, though... it's just been really weird."

speaker: Doctor
text:
I'd like to take a look at the swelling now. Can you please lift your right leg up for me, and I'll examine it further? Also, have you experienced any similar swelling or issues in other parts of your body, such as your elbows or ankles?

And, have you noticed any triggers that make the swelling worse, such as standing for long periods or bending your knee in certain ways?

speaker: Patient
text: "Okay, I'll lift my leg up. And, yeah, I think it gets worse when I bend my knee or put weight on it, but I'm not really sure why. My parents said that my uncle had to change what he did to play sports because of it, but I don't know what that means."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me about your family history, specifically any relatives who may have had similar knee problems or joint issues?

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, my mom said that her uncle on her side of the family had something similar to this, but I'm not really sure what it was. He had to stop playing sports because of it, and it made him really sore and swollen. I don't know if that's what I have, but my mom said it's possible that I might have a family history of it."

speaker: Doctor
text:
Can you tell me more about your family history, specifically any relatives who may have had similar knee problems or joint issues?



Also, can you walk me through a typical day for you - do you engage in any activities that involve repetitive knee bending or twisting?



I'd also like to request a test: REQUEST TEST: X-Ray_ Knee

speaker: Doctor
text:
So the swelling started about six weeks ago and has been getting progressively worse. You've experienced a dull ache, but it can get sharp when you move your knee or put weight on it. I'm going to take a closer look at the swelling. Can you please move your leg slightly and show me where the swelling is most pronounced?

Also, can you tell me more about your job and any activities that might be contributing to the swelling? Do you have a job that involves standing or kneeling for long periods, or any hobbies that might be putting repetitive stress on your knee?

speaker: Patient
text: "It's most pronounced at the joint line, where my knee meets my shin. And, yeah, I'm a bit of a ballerina, so I do a lot of jumping and landing, which I guess could be contributing to it. But I don't think that's all of it, because my parents said my uncle had to stop playing sports because of it, and I'm not really a big athlete."

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your family history, specifically any relatives who may have had similar knee problems or joint issues?

speaker: Patient
text: "Well, like I said, my mom's uncle had something similar to this, and he had to stop playing sports because of it. He was really sore and swollen, and it made him unable to do the things he loved. I don't know if it's the same thing, but my mom said it's possible that I might have a family history of it."

text: I've taken a closer look at the swelling, and it appears to be quite pronounced in the medial aspect of the knee. Can you tell me more about your family history, specifically any relatives who may have had similar knee problems or joint issues?

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your job and any activities that involve repetitive knee bending or twisting? Do you engage in any sports or physical activities that might be contributing to the swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm a ballerina, so I do a lot of jumping and landing, which I guess could be contributing to it. But I don't think that's all of it, because my parents said my uncle had to stop playing sports because of it, and I'm not really a big athlete. I do have to say, though, that I've noticed I'm using my left knee more than usual when I'm walking, and I've been having to stop and rest more often because of the pain."

speaker: Doctor
text:
